Sentencas: Biogas contains trace compounds detrimental for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) application, especially sulphur-containing compounds and volatile organic silicon compounds (VOSiCs).
Titulo: Comparison of adsorbents for H2S and D4 removal for biogas conversion in a solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: It is therefore necessary to remove these impurities from the biogas for fuelling an SOFC.
Titulo: Comparison of adsorbents for H2S and D4 removal for biogas conversion in a solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: In this paper, dynamic lab-scale adsorption tests were performed on synthetic polluted gas to evaluate the performance of a polishing treatment to remove hydrogen sulphide (H2S - sulphur compound) and octamethylcyclotetrasiloxane (D4 - VOSiC).
Titulo: Comparison of adsorbents for H2S and D4 removal for biogas conversion in a solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Three kinds of adsorbents were tested: an activated carbon, a silica gel (SG) and a zeolite (Z).
Titulo: Comparison of adsorbents for H2S and D4 removal for biogas conversion in a solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Z proved to be the best adsorbent for H2S removal, with an adsorbed quantity higher than 75 mgH(2)S/g(Z) at the SOFC tolerance limit.
Titulo: Comparison of adsorbents for H2S and D4 removal for biogas conversion in a solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: However, as concerns D4 removal, SG was the most efficient adsorbent, with an adsorbed quantity of about 184mg(D4)/g(SG) at the SOFC tolerance limit.
Titulo: Comparison of adsorbents for H2S and D4 removal for biogas conversion in a solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: These results could not be explained by structural characteristics of the adsorbents, but they were partly explained by chemical interactions between the adsorbate and the adsorbent.
Titulo: Comparison of adsorbents for H2S and D4 removal for biogas conversion in a solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: In these experiments, internal diffusion was the controlling step, Knudsen diffusion being predominant to molecular diffusion.
Titulo: Comparison of adsorbents for H2S and D4 removal for biogas conversion in a solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: As Z was also a good adsorbent for D4 removal, competition phenomena were investigated with Z for the simultaneous removal of H2S and D4.
Titulo: Comparison of adsorbents for H2S and D4 removal for biogas conversion in a solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: It was shown that H2S retention was dramatically decreased in the presence of D4, probably due to D4 polymerization resulting in pore blocking.
Titulo: Comparison of adsorbents for H2S and D4 removal for biogas conversion in a solid oxide fuel cell
Comparison of adsorbents for H2S and D4 removal for biogas conversion in a solid oxide fuel cell
